body.p:
Munfordville Oct 28th 1863
A. M. Gazly Esq
My Dear Sir,

The enclosed paper speaks for itself. Use it as you judge but. I have been from home for the past 6 or 8 days & only arrived at home last evening, which will explain why I have not at an earlier day manifested the deep interest I feel for my old & long tried and devoted friend Mr Gorin who I love as my own dear brother. I sincerely trust that the Governor may at once and without delay pardon him. Can I serve Mr Gorin in this matter, in any other way if I can let me know it at once & I stand ready to do it.

I am
Respectfully
G. T. Wood

A. M. Gazley esq
Louisville
Kentucky
